parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The website promotes itself as a source of information to help voters make informed choices, but doesn't endorse any particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and aims to reach a wide audience, as evidenced by the reach estimate of ">1M".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the electoral process, its objective is not to directly influence the vote for a specific candidate. The website aims to provide information to help voters make informed decisions, which is not inherently a violation. The post encourages users to visit a website for information, not to vote for a specific candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be interpreted as a form of citizen journalism, aiming to provide information about the electoral process. The website's stated goal is to provide information from public sources, which aligns with journalistic principles.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it promotes a website offering electoral information.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>913636477357291</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a website ("aflapecinevotezi.ro") that aims to provide voters with information to make informed choices during the election.  While the post is related to the election and is a paid advertisement, it does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party. The website itself claims to gather information from public sources.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The post's objective appears to be informative rather than persuasive in favor of a particular candidate.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement doesn't automatically make it electoral propaganda; the content itself must be analyzed.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Afla pe cine votezi</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
